data.title: Various GUI Improvements
data.body:
Added Range and Step on inspectable fields.
Integrated styling logic
Fixed regex not accepting values such as '.5'
Improved Win32 char input handling

data.title: Fixed typo
data.body: Corrected "manager object" in "managed object"

data.title: Changed GUID to UUID
data.body: In order to keep the same naming convention

data.title: Linux fixes
data.body:
Hello, here are a bunch of build fixes on Linux. Like my previous pull request, there should be no logical change.

Feel free to criticize.

data.title: Mysterious #defines
data.body:
In `Source/BansheeCore/Include/BsRenderAPICapabilities.h`, there's a couple of mysterious `#defines`:

```
#define CAPS_CATEGORY_SIZE 8i64
#define BS_CAPS_BITSHIFT (64i64 - CAPS_CATEGORY_SIZE)
#define CAPS_CATEGORY_MASK (((1i64 << CAPS_CATEGORY_SIZE) - 1i64) << BS_CAPS_BITSHIFT)
#define BS_CAPS_VALUE(cat, val) ((cat << BS_CAPS_BITSHIFT) | (1i64 << val))
```

What are `8i64`, `1i64` and `64i64`? I have never seen this syntax, and neither has gcc, apparently ;-).

data.title: On the use of wide strings as paths
Feature Request: BSP Meshes
data.body: It would be awesome if there was support for some sort of BSP mesh for rapid prototyping level design. I find them much nicer to work with than primitives.

data.title: BansheeEngine (Discussion)
data.body:
After a cursory acquaintance with the engine the impression that somewhere in all this is seen :)
I would like to know what your engine will be favorable differ from the Unity 3D?
What are the goals you are pursuing? Maybe you simply want to increase their skills in the development of engines? Or do you have a look at how the engine should look like?

data.title: Streaming Audio support
data.body: Consider adding stream Audio support, you can have background thread for Audio and stream data from file system.

data.title: Dont delete last compiled assembly
data.body:
Since generated assembly was deleted each time before compiling, it would prevent user from editing existing attached script components due to the missing assembly if there's any error in compilation. 

One possible solution is displaying nagging overly stating "There was compile error in your scripts, please fix it...", but meanwhile still let user editing the scene if they choose to.

data.title: Linux
data.body:
Hello fellow human being,

I just checked out this fine project, and as I am under Linux, here are a few changes I made, with the aim of starting to port the code. Those are mainly build fixes, with (I think) no logical impacts.

Feel free to review, comment, pull, cherry-pick or reject those. ;-)

Also, be aware that I have never done a pull request on Github, so if I screwed up anything, please let me know.

data.title: DX11 debug layer on windows 10
data.body:
Creating dx11 device with debug layer on windows 10 failed.

Found solution on [stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32809169/use-d3d11-debug-layer-with-vs2013-on-windows-10), so maybe add this info here [here](https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/blob/preview/Documentation/GitHub/compiling.md)?

data.title: Cmake changes
data.body:
- Add BsTimer to Cmake build.
- Change the way clang detection in cmake is done
- add gcc case in compiler detection

data.title: Build system: Fix directory name for case sensitive file systems
data.body: Might help people who try crosscompiling from linux to windows

data.title: Continous Intergration
data.body:
I'd suggest setting up Travis CI and AppVeyor CI builds that way you will have free continous builds on OSX, Windows, and Linux. It requires two files in the repo and a little bit of setup magic.

I'm at work right now and looking through the source so I can see it looks like you only have windows builds working at the moment? So this might be something you want to do only on AppVeyor to begin with.

You should be able to set it up to be able to let you provide download links to the latest builds from these services too.

data.title: Consider using google's breakpad as crashhandler
data.body:
I see that you have added the CrashHandler which is cool! 

Google's Breakpad knows how to do crash handling for many platforms including support for minidumps on Windows

data.title: Replace windows.h with std::chrono for time utils
data.body:
https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/blob/preview/Source/BansheeUtility/Source/BsTime.cpp
https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/blob/preview/Source/BansheeUtility/Source/Win32/BsWin32Timer.cpp

data.title: Possibly a missing break statement?
data.body: I was just looking through the codebase and found what looks like a bug - missing break statement here https://github.com/BearishSun/BansheeEngine/blob/preview/Source/BansheeGLRenderAPI/Source/GLSL/src/BsGLSLGpuProgram.cpp#L123, which will cause `GL_TESS_EVALUATION_SHADER` to get overwritten.

data.body: What is/will be the license for this engine?
